\N<Irime>...I can't say 'forgive me', can I? That's how far off the

\N<Rame>But... I really want to forgive you. I want to forgive you
because... it's just so painful...
\N<Irime>Rame...

\N<Rame>But, but... I think that's only natural. After all, I've
always relied on you, Mother. I couldn't support you when
you were going through such hard times.
\N<Rame>So... I think it's a punishment that's come back to me.

\N<Irime>That's not true... Your very existence has always been a

your face helped me keep going.

\N<Irime>You've grown into such a good daughter... There's not a

\N<Irime>It's me who should apologize, for not being able to lay out

\N<Rame>If so... then surely things will start to brighten from here

The things that the Luda's militia brought to this town...
were numerous deep and terrible wounds.

However, the town was beginning to show signs of settling
down...

There was a growing sense of hope that perhaps the militia
and even Luda itself would fade away, and the town could
return to its former state.

It was at this time that people began to finally confront
their own wounds with this faint hope in their hearts...

\N<Luda Soldier>Your wife Irime failed to appear at the training assembly

\N<Luda Soldier>It's only natural. Your wife did the same. Do you
understand? If you say you can't do it, then blaming us

\N<Irime>Wha...?!
\N<Rame>Eh...?!
\N<Irime's Husband>Wh-What is it!? What do you want...!?

\N<Luda Soldier>Heh, the whole family's here, how convenient. Were you
perhaps waiting for us?
\N<Irime's Husband>Get out! This isn't a place for beasts like you...!

\N<Luda Soldier>A guy who can't even fight and relies on his wife and
daughter to take care of him has no right to speak. Save
those brave words for when you're leading the charge in
battle.
\N<Irime's Husband>Grr...!!
\N<Rame>Mama...?!

\N<Irime>What do you want!? If it's about the aftermath of the
battle, I told you I'd come to the management office later!

The ones surrounding the mother and daughter were the Luda
soldiers they had fought in the previous judgment battle,
along with their comrades.

Each of them leered at Irime and Rame's bodies, and everyone
present wore a depraved smile.

\N<Irime>Answer me! What do you want!? What business do you have here
now of all times!?

\N<Luda Soldier>Hmph, whether we talk now or later, the result will be the
same. Might as well get it over with sooner for both our
sakes.

\N<Irime>Get out! I don't know what you're talking about, but we who
lost in the judgment battle will soon be under Luda's
control... That's right, isn't it!?

\N<Luda Soldier>Heh, that's right. Aside from that useless old man, you
mother and daughter will indeed be under our control.

\N<Irime>Then we're already your subordinates and comrades, aren't
we!? What else is there to talk about!?
\N<Rame>M-Me and Mama... becoming comrades with these people...?

\N<Irime>Get out! You have no business here, do you!? A future for an
officer who doesn't care for his comrades and barges into
other people's homes like this!?
\N<Rame>Eh...?!
\N<Irime>Stop it! Take your hands off my daughter!

One of the Luda soldiers began lifting Rame's clothes. Rame
froze at the act, unable to even voice her rejection.
\N<Rame>Ah... ah...?!

\N<Luda Soldier>Heh, an officer who doesn't care for his comrades has no
future, you say. But indeed, that's true. However... this
matter has already been approved by Lord Zuuteruka.
\N<Irime>Wh-What... Zuuteruka has...?!

\N<Luda Soldier>We who have won the battle and earned the right can enter
the house of the defeated without being charged with a
crime.

\N<Luda Soldier>Why is that? Because we have a mission more important than
respecting future comrades as you say.

\N<Irime>A mission so important it's laughable...! It's just some
worthless task, isn't it!?
\N<Rame>N-No...!?
\N<Irime>Gah! Take your filthy hands off my daughter!

\N<Luda Soldier>Heh! A worthless mission!? Not at all! It's a mission so
noble there's hardly anything more important!
\N<Rame>N-No... stop... let go...

\N<Luda Soldier>Our mission is to increase the number of babies who will
grow up to be soldiers of Luda... or as courtesans. That's
our important mission!
\N<Rame>Eh...?!

To defile the mother and daughter and impregnate them with
Luda's offspring. They shamelessly declared their
intentions.
\N<Irime>You fiends...!!

\N<Irime's Husband>S-Stop... please stop! I'll listen to whatever you say in

\N<Irime's Husband>So please! Don't lay a hand on my wife or daughter!

Struck by the Luda soldiers, Irime's husband crawls on the
